text: 14.110 In line with the street hierarchy discussed under Policy PS4, the needs of pedestrians and those using the pavement should be given the highest priority. In many instances, existing pavements are narrow and filled with physical clutter (such as fixed street furniture or parked cars), or consist of uneven or easily damaged surface material that can make movement difficult for those with pushchairs or those in wheelchairs. Part 1(e) requires that pedestrian routes should be wide enough to accommodate the needs of all those who use them. Tower Hamlets Local Plan 189 PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES
